intro: Byttneria macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited byttneria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its large, woody structure and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant produces large, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems it inhabits.
